docs.abstract: Senator Bernie Sanders, the Vermont independent whose populist agenda has helped push the Democratic Party to the left, is running for president again.
docs.snippet: Senator Bernie Sanders, the Vermont independent whose populist agenda has helped push the Democratic Party to the left, is running for president again.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Tuesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Bernie Sanders Announces 2020 Bid

docs.abstract: President Trump’s move, aimed at securing funding for a border wall, is a serious challenge to congressional authority. It remains to be seen whether Senate Republicans will try to stop it.
docs.snippet: President Trump’s move, aimed at securing funding for a border wall, is a serious challenge to congressional authority. It remains to be seen whether Senate Republicans will try to stop it.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Monday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today. (Note: The evening edition of On Politics With Lisa Lerer is off today for the Presidents’ Day holiday.)

headline.main: On Politics: Trump’s Emergency Declaration Divides Republicans

docs.abstract: The president said the U.S. should recognize Israel’s authority over the Golan Heights, one of the world’s most disputed areas, reversing long-held American policy.
docs.snippet: The president said the U.S. should recognize Israel’s authority over the Golan Heights, one of the world’s most disputed areas, reversing long-held American policy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Friday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Trump’s Tweet Reverses Decades of Policy on Israel

docs.abstract: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said to colleagues that it was clear President Trump had engaged in behavior “which does not bring honor to the office he holds.”
docs.snippet: Speaker Nancy Pelosi said to colleagues that it was clear President Trump had engaged in behavior “which does not bring honor to the office he holds.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Tuesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Pelosi Cautions on Impeachment

docs.abstract: The Judiciary Committee voted to recommend that the attorney general be held in contempt of Congress for failing to turn over the full Mueller report.
docs.snippet: The Judiciary Committee voted to recommend that the attorney general be held in contempt of Congress for failing to turn over the full Mueller report.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Thursday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: House Panel Recommends Holding Barr in Contempt

docs.abstract: The New York Times obtained tax numbers from 1985 to 1994. They show that President Trump lost more than a billion dollars in that period.
docs.snippet: The New York Times obtained tax numbers from 1985 to 1994. They show that President Trump lost more than a billion dollars in that period.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Wednesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: A Decade of Trump’s Taxes

docs.abstract: President Trump’s decision to renew his trade war with China will hurt consumers — a contradiction to his claim that his tariffs are a mostly one-way payment by China.
docs.snippet: President Trump’s decision to renew his trade war with China will hurt consumers — a contradiction to his claim that his tariffs are a mostly one-way payment by China.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Monday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Americans Will Face Economic Pain From the Trade War

docs.abstract: Republicans lost four key governorships in the Midwest. Now conservative lawmakers fear the new Democratic governors will alter their gerrymandered maps.
docs.snippet: Republicans lost four key governorships in the Midwest. Now conservative lawmakers fear the new Democratic governors will alter their gerrymandered maps.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Tuesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Midwest Republicans Fear Losing a Gerrymandered Advantage

docs.abstract: Prosecutors took a big step in their inquiry into payouts made to two women ahead of the 2016 election, saying that The National Enquirer’s parent company was cooperating.
docs.snippet: Prosecutors took a big step in their inquiry into payouts made to two women ahead of the 2016 election, saying that The National Enquirer’s parent company was cooperating.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Thursday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Tabloid Company Agrees to Cooperate in Trump Hush-Money Inquiry

docs.abstract: The deepest impasse between President Trump and congressional leaders is over his demand for a border wall, which Democrats have refused to accept.
docs.snippet: The deepest impasse between President Trump and congressional leaders is over his demand for a border wall, which Democrats have refused to accept.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Monday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.
